intro: Buhsea raddeana, commonly known as the Chinese sandmat, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley. The plant is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming structure with small, green leaves. Its flowers are white or pale yellow and appear in umbels, typical of the family. Buhsea raddeana is often found in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
